required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study of Subcutaneously Administered JNJ-75220795
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Randomized, Multipart, Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Subcutaneously Administered JNJ-75220795

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the safety and tolerability of single and multiple subcutaneous (SC) doses of JNJ-75220795.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Signs and Symptoms/ Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment-emergent signs and symptoms/adverse events (including allergic reactions/hypersensitivity and local injection site reactions) will be reported. An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant participating in a clinical study that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the pharmaceutical/biological agent under study. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) are defined as AEs with onset or worsening on or after date of first dose of study treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline in Vital Signs Abnormalities
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with change from baseline in vital signs abnormalities including temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and blood pressure (supine) will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline in Clinical Laboratory Abnormalities
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with change from baseline in clinical laboratory abnormalities including hematology, chemistry and urinalysis will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline in Physical Examination Abnormalities
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with change from baseline in physical examination abnormalities will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with change from baseline in ECG abnormalities will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Liver Fat Content
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in liver fat content will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of JNJ-75220795 Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: SAD: Predose, up to Day 3 and MAD: Predose, up to Day 86
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples will be analyzed to determine concentrations of JNJ-75220795.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent Anti Drug Antibodies (ADA)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with treatment-emergent ADA will be assessed using a validated assay for ADA analysis.

arm_group.description: Participants in cohorts 1-5 and cohorts 3a-5a will receive subcutaneous (SC) injection of single dose (Part A) of JNJ-75220795 or matching placebo.

Participants in cohorts 6-8 will receive SC injection of 2 doses (Part B) of JNJ-75220795 or matching placebo. Participants in cohorts 9-11 will receive SC injection of 4 doses (Part C) of JNJ-75220795 or matching placebo.

intervention.description: Matching placebo will be administered subcutaneously.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with certain genetic predisposition to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) determined at screening
- Presence of liver steatosis at screening
- Participants on anti-hypertensive and/or lipid lowering medications and/or glucose lowering medications must be on stable dose(s) for at least 4 weeks prior to screening
- Weight stable defined as no more than 5% body weight loss or gain within 3 months prior to screening and no more than 5% body weight loss or gain from screening to randomization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergies, hypersensitivity, or intolerance to JNJ-75220795 or its excipients
- History of hepatitis B surface antigen (HbsAg) or hepatitis C antibody (anti-HCV) positive, or other clinically active liver disease, or tests positive for HbsAg or anti-HCV at screening
- History of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antibody positive, or tests positive for HIV at screening

overall_official.last_name: Janssen Research & Development, LLC Clinical Trial

link.description: To learn how to participate in this trial please click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: The data sharing policy of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson is available at www.janssen.com/clinical-trials/transparency. As noted on this site, requests for access to the study data can be submitted through Yale Open Data Access (YODA) Project site at yoda.yale.edu
